result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy L. Deckert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Dodge Correctional as reception center.  All costs owed in this case have been removed from the cash bond.  Defendant's costs balance is $0.  Defendant to be eligible for programming as indicated.
Conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Timothy L. Deckert in court with attorney Stephen Eric Mays. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing in both 14CF37 and 14CF74.  DA Harper informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution:  in 14CF37, def pleading to Count 1/OWI 7th; IID charge would be dismissed.  In 14CF74, def pleading to Count 1/OWI 8th (without the enhancer for child passenger) and Count 2/bail jumping.

Def pleads no contest to Count 1/OWI 7th in 14CF37 and to Counts 1 and 2 of 14CF74 with Count 1 as OWI 7/8/9 without child passenger (OWI 8th).  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Court notes 6 priors.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court re the sentence they are proposing as a resolution.  Atty. Mays asks that all fines/costs in these matters be taken out of posted bond.

Sentence:  

Count 1 in 14CF37 - 8 years prison with 3 years initial conf. followed by 5 years ext. supervision.  Conditions:  absolute sobriety; AODA/follow through; 24 mo revocation; 24 mo IID upon relicensing; fine/costs. 14CF74, 10 years prison with 5 in/5 ES; costs (not fine and costs - just costs).  Same conditions.  3 years probation, consecutive to the sentences in these cases, for the bail jumping/Count 2 in 14CF74.  Def to submit DNA sample at the Richland County Jail before transport to prison.

Prison sentences to run concurrent with each other.  Count 3 in 14CF74 dismissed/read in.  Def to be eligible for programming.  Dodge as reception center.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 10:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-20-2015 10:00 am

Mays states that these matters are resolved but defense is requesting adjournment to November; states reasons for the request.  Court allows adj. of these matters until Nov. 20th.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Aug. 5 at 10 for further status.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
